<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
VENTURE CAPITAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/21/wsj-peter-thiel-wants-get-latestage-companies?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Peter Thiel Wants to Show Up Late
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Peter Thiel Wants to Show Up Late" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcxNjkxMzA1LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Neilson Barnard/Getty Images for New York Times</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Riffling through our billionaires Rolodex, we noticed the T's are a little short on love. Time to check in on Peter Thiel, outspoken tech investor and PayPal Mafia member. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Thiel's venture capital firm Founders Fund is looking to <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/peter-thiels-founders-fund-building-new-war-chest-in-strategy-shift-11571672563?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">raise $2.7 billion</a> by Q1 2020, the WSJ reported yesterday. $1.5 billion is earmarked for investments in late-stage startups, a departure from the firm's usual strategy.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Founders Fund typically invests in really young startups. It's been one of the Bay Area's most successful VC shops, having written checks to Facebook, SpaceX, Airbnb, Spotify, Lyft, and Postmates. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>But now that companies are staying private longer, each round of funding can dilute the value of the stakes held by early investors.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Which brings us to the latest VC trend: <strong style="color:#000">growth-stage financing</strong>. Popularized by Masayoshi Son and SoftBank’s Vision Fund, it means chunky investments in older, more mature companies. But as we’ve seen with the SoftBank/WeWork saga, it doesn’t always work out. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">When he's not scouting out startups...</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Well, VCs are never <em>not</em> on the hunt. But on the side, Thiel's also been...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.vanityfair.com/news/2019/10/peter-thiel-dinners-are-the-hottest-ticket-in-la-whats-his-endgame?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Hosting</a></span><span> L.A. dinner parties that are the "hottest ticket in town," bringing together everyone from celebrities and pro wrestlers to tech execs and podcasters.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://medium.com/@foundersfund/hereticon-2bb9b23928d5?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Planning</a></span><span> Founders Fund's Hereticon, a conference for "heretical thinkers" and "thoughtcrime." </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/08/01/opinion/peter-thiel-google.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Blasting</a></span><span> Google's AI research efforts in China for undermining American security. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://fortune.com/2019/10/15/what-is-bitcoin-mining-layer1-peter-thiel-crypto-investment/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Doubling down</a></span><span> on bitcoin, specifically an environmentally conscious startup taking on China's market dominance in crypto mining. A few years ago, Founders Fund </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/peter-thiels-founders-fund-makes-big-bet-on-bitcoin-1514917433?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bought</a></span><span> around $15 million to $20 million in bitcoin. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>a lifelong libertarian, Thiel's a loud critic of left-leaning Silicon Valley, where he’s made more than a few enemies for backing President Trump (Thiel spoke at the 2016 Republican National Convention). With ongoing China tensions and the 2020 election ramping up, you'll probably be seeing his name around.</p>

<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Thiel%27s+hot+for+the+latest+VC+trend+&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/21/wsj-peter-thiel-wants-get-latestage-companies&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CORPORATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/21/softbank-take-control-wework-around-8b-valuation?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Masayoshi Hasselhoff to the Rescue
</font></a>
</h1>

<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Masayoshi Hasselhoff to the Rescue" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=503 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/hZkJIRzVyrXI4/giphy.gif">

<img class="story-header-image" alt="Masayoshi Hasselhoff to the Rescue" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/hZkJIRzVyrXI4/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">SoftBank is in late-stage talks to take control of WeWork through a deal that would give the Japanese conglomerate as much as a 70% stake, <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/10/21/softbank-to-take-control-of-wework-sources.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CNBC reported</a> yesterday. The deal pegs WeWork’s value between $7.5 billion and $8 billion...juuuust a bit shy of the $47 billion valuation it got from SoftBank in January. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The takeover could </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-10-21/softbank-seeks-to-take-control-of-wework-in-bailout-deal?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">include</a></span><span> up to $3 billion in purchases of existing stock and $5 billion in debt financing, Bloomberg reports. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It would also further reduce WeWork co-founder Adam Neumann’s stake and install SoftBank’s Marcelo Claure in the c-suite.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">WeWork’s board is expected to <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/softbank-offers-to-put-6-5b-into-wework-including-5b-loan-11571687872?mod=hp_lead_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">meet today</a> to discuss the takeover as well as a loan package presented by JPMorgan.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PHARMA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/21/drug-companies-reach-settlement-ahead-opioid-trial?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Drug Companies Dodge the Music
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Drug Companies Dodge the Music" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcxNjkxNTk0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, three top drug distributors and an opioid manufacturer reached a $260 million settlement ahead of what would’ve been the <a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2019/10/21/771847539/opioid-trial-4-companies-reach-tentative-settlement-with-ohio-counties?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first federal trial</a> over the opioid crisis. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> The trial set to begin yesterday was expected to form a template for other federal cases against opioid companies. Now, prosecutors for future opioid cases will have to crack open their dusty law review books. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Show me the terms... </strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>McKesson, Cardinal Health, and AmerisourceBergen (all distributors) </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/four-drug-companies-reach-last-minute-settlement-in-opioid-litigation-11571658212?mod=hp_lead_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">agreed</a></span><span> to Venmo $215 million to two Ohio counties. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Teva, an Israel-based manufacturer, will provide $25 billion in opioid addiction treatment drugs and pay $20 million in cash over three years. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Neither settlement includes an admission of liability. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The big picture:</strong> Over 2,000 counties, cities, and states have sued more than a dozen drug companies over the opioid crisis, which cost the U.S. an estimated $631 billion from 2015 to 2018, <a href="https://www.soa.org/globalassets/assets/files/resources/research-report/2019/econ-impact-non-medical-opioid-use.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per the Society of Actuaries</a>. </p>
<div class="c-message__content c-message__content--feature_sonic_inputs" data-qa="message_content"><span class="c-message__body" data-qa="message-text">This Ohio case could still serve as a model for settlements of thousands of other cases.</span></div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Walgreens Boots Alliance was targeted in the suit but didn’t reach a deal. The trial against it has been postponed.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TAX
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/21/new-study-shines-light-benefit-estate-taxes?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The State of Estate Taxes
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="The State of Estate Taxes" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcxNjkyNDg0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Economists from UC Berkeley and the San Francisco Fed recently released <a href="https://www.nber.org/papers/w26387?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">a study</a> on state-level estate taxes, which are taxes on the transfer of assets when someone dies. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Tl;dr:</strong> Rich people like their money and <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/10/20/business/economy/estate-tax.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will</a> move across state borders to hold on to it. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Before 2001, estate taxes were counterbalanced by a federal tax credit.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>But then in 2001, President George W. Bush did away with the federal credit...</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>...and the number of Forbes 400 billionaires living in estate tax states fell 35%. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So states started dropping them. Now, only 12 states and Washington, D.C., have estate taxes. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The twist: </strong>That wasn’t necessarily the right call. The study’s authors said over the long haul the revenue states can earn from a 16% estate tax exceeds the income tax revenue they lose when billionaires move. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>If Jeff Bezos died, Washington State would receive almost $12 billion, nearly half its annual revenue. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Wealthy residents benefit states. The question is which tax scheme works best.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PODCAST
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/21/not-1953-sallie-krawcheck-workplace-diversity?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
It's Not 1953: Sallie Krawcheck on Workplace Diversity
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="It's Not 1953: Sallie Krawcheck on Workplace Diversity" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcxNjkyMDMzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You <em>know</em> what the right thing to do is...but can you<em> act</em> on it? Today on Morning Brew’s podcast <em>Business Casual</em>, Ellevest co-founder and CEO Sallie Krawcheck is tackling one of the biggest questions in business: <strong style="color:#000">workplace diversity</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As Krawcheck sees it, we’ve read enough studies proving a more diverse workplace yields higher returns for investors (15% higher, per recent reports). Now, it’s time to do something about the pay gaps, investing gaps, savings gaps, and more problems that hold top talent back. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In this episode of <em>Business Casual</em>, Krawcheck also explains…</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Which companies and CEOs are doing things right</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Why women-founded startups (think The Wing, Outdoor Voices, Glossier) are thriving</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Why impact investing doesn’t mean sacrificing returns</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">She knows what she’s talking about: </strong>Prior to building Ellevest, Krawcheck was CEO of Merrill Lynch Wealth Management, CEO of Citi Wealth Management, and CEO at Smith Barney.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Listen to the episode: </strong><a href="https://link.chtbl.com/krawcheckapple?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Apple</a> / <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/Krawcheck_Spotify?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Spotify</a> / <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/krawcheck_stitcher?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Stitcher</a> </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Written by
<a href="https://twitter.com/Neal_Freyman" class="link" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Neal Freyman</a>, <a href="https://twitter.com/ElizaCarter34" class="link" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Eliza Carter</a>, <a href="https://twitter.com/its_ahickey" class="link" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Alex Hickey</a>, and <a href="https://twitter.com/KinseyGrant" class="link" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Kinsey Grant</a>

the T's are a little short on love. Time to check in on Peter Thiel, outspoken tech investor and PayPal Mafia member. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThiel's venture capital firm Founders Fund is looking to \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/peter-thiels-founders-fund-building-new-war-chest-in-strategy-shift-11571672563?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eraise $2.7 billion\u003c/a\u003e by Q1 2020, the WSJ reported yesterday. $1.5 billion is earmarked for investments in late-stage startups, a departure from the firm's usual strategy.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFounders Fund typically invests in really young startups. It's been one of the Bay Area's most successful VC shops, having written checks to Facebook, SpaceX, Airbnb, Spotify, Lyft, and Postmates. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBut now that companies are staying private longer, each round of funding can dilute the value of the stakes held by early investors.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhich brings us to the latest VC trend: \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003egrowth-stage financing\u003c/strong\u003e. Popularized by Masayoshi Son and SoftBank’s Vision Fund, it means chunky investments in older, more mature companies. But as we’ve seen with the SoftBank/WeWork saga, it doesn’t always work out. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhen he's not scouting out startups...\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWell, VCs are never \u003cem\u003enot\u003c/em\u003e on the hunt. But on the side, Thiel's also been...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eHosting\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e L.A. dinner parties that are the \"hottest ticket in town,\" manufacturer reached a $260 million settlement ahead of what would’ve been the \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2019/10/21/771847539/opioid-trial-4-companies-reach-tentative-settlement-with-ohio-counties?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efirst federal trial\u003c/a\u003e over the opioid crisis. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e The trial set to begin yesterday was expected to form a template for other federal cases against opioid companies. Now, prosecutors for future opioid cases will have to crack open their dusty law review books. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eShow me the terms... \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eMcKesson, Cardinal Health, and AmerisourceBergen (all distributors) \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/four-drug-companies-reach-last-minute-settlement-in-opioid-litigation-11571658212?mod=hp_lead_pos1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eagreed\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to Venmo $215 million to two Ohio counties. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTeva, an Israel-based manufacturer, will provide $25 billion in opioid addiction treatment drugs and pay $20 million in cash over three years. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNeither settlement includes an admission of liability. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe big picture:\u003c/strong\u003e Over 2,000 counties, cities, and states have sued more than a dozen drug companies over the opioid crisis, which cost the U.S. an estimated $631 billion from 2015 to 2018, \u003ca href=\"https://www.soa.org/globalassets/assets/files/resources/research-report/2019/econ-impact-non-medical-opioid-use.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eper the Society of Actuaries\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cdiv class=\"c-message__content c-message__content--feature_sonic_inputs\" data-qa=\"message_content\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"c-message__body\" data-qa=\"message-text\"\u003eThis Ohio case could still serve as a model for settlements of thousands of other cases.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eWalgreens Boots Alliance was targeted in the suit but didn’t reach a deal. collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEconomists from UC Berkeley and the San Francisco Fed recently released \u003ca href=\"https://www.nber.org/papers/w26387?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ea study\u003c/a\u003e on state-level estate taxes, which are taxes on the transfer of assets when someone dies. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTl;dr:\u003c/strong\u003e Rich people like their money and \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/10/20/business/economy/estate-tax.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewill\u003c/a\u003e move across state borders to hold on to it. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eBefore 2001, estate taxes were counterbalanced by a federal tax credit.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBut then in 2001, President George W. Bush did away with the federal credit...\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e...and the number of Forbes 400 billionaires living in estate tax states fell 35%. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo states started dropping them. Now, only 12 states and Washington, D.C., have estate taxes. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe twist: \u003c/strong\u003eThat wasn’t necessarily the right call. The study’s authors said over the long haul the revenue states can earn from a 16% estate tax exceeds the income tax revenue they lose when billionaires move. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIf Jeff Bezos died, Washington State would receive almost $12 billion, nearly half its annual revenue. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eWealthy residents benefit states.
